content.webTitle: Rise in debtors but fall in profit for doorstep lender

fields.headline: Rise in debtors but fall in profit for doorstep lender
fields.bodyText: The doorstep lender Provident Financial, which came into conflict with regulators last year over excessive loan rates, saw first-half profits fall 20% as it invested in its credit card business and start-ups in Mexico and Romania. Pre-tax profits were 25% lower at £66.5m, hit by £19.1m of investment in new businesses and higher UK marketing costs. But the lender said its core UK business, which mainly lends to poorer families at rates up to 50%, had grown 1% to 1.47 million borrowers. Provident also confirmed the demerger next spring of its growing international arm, focused on central Europe.
